commit_message:
Vendor concat function to support stdlib 3.2

Many installations are pinned to stdlib 3.2. This change vendors
the concat function from stdlib 4 until Puppet Enterprise
catches up. At that point the vendored function will be removed.

Change-Id: Ifae939292c7d03b62aa62f205109409c26e9503d
(cherry picked from commit 75324729abdc86de0e744c825242a1d9b74f2a47)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tempest refs/changes/88/92288/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # # os_concat.rb # module Puppet::Parser::Functions newfunction(:os_concat, :type => :rvalue, :doc => <<-EOS Appends the contents of array 2 onto array 1. *Example:* os_concat(['1','2','3'],['4','5','6']) Would result in: ['1','2','3','4','5','6'] EOS ) do |arguments| # Check that 2 arguments have been given ... raise(Puppet::ParseError, "os_concat(): Wrong number of arguments " + "given (#{arguments.size} for 2)") if arguments.size != 2 a = arguments[0] b = arguments[1] # Check that the first parameter is an array unless a.is_a?(Array) raise(Puppet::ParseError, 'os_concat(): Requires array to work with') end if b.is_a?(Array) result = a.concat(b) else result = a << b end return result end end # vim: set ts=2 sw=2 et :

commit_message:
Improve hacking rule to avoid author markers

The case with the tag "moduleauthor" is not handled when
checking to avoid author makers.
Also fix the position when the tag Author is used.

Change-Id: I17b07b9f5448f9cbb4c5705f655c5392316a6239
Closes-Bug: #1314176

commit_message:
Skip auth in cinderclient

cinderclient can't work well with keystone v3 auth
info. We should do it in openstackclient just like
compute extension.

Closes-Bug: #1315963
Change-Id: I46f794c5315f6a9fe1d9a0e5dc7b84f067d7f792
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient refs/changes/29/92029/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Populate the Cinder client to skip another auth query to Identity if instance._url: # token flow client.client.management_url = instance._url else: # password flow client.client.management_url = instance.get_endpoint_for_service_type( API_NAME) client.client.service_catalog = instance._service_catalog client.client.auth_token = instance._token

commit_message:
Refer local_settings in doc to customize settings

There are couple of places in the docs where it isn't explicitly
mentioned whether to modify settings.py or local_settings.py to
customize settings (this might not be obvious to people who are new
to Horizon and Django).

The changes include:
- In the `Customizing Horizon` guide, under the section 'Modifying
  Existing Dashboards and Panels', explicitly mention local_settings.py
  file to be modified to update ``HORIZON_CONFIG`` setting
- In the QuickStart guide, under the `Setup` section, add a note which
  mentions that to customize any settings use the local_settings.py file
- In the 2013 Havana release notes, under section `Upgrade Information'
  for 'Allowed Hosts', specify only local_settings.py file to add the
  new 'ALLOWED_HOSTS' setting (instead of settings.py or local_settings.py)

Change-Id: I38314cadd8a5a61d1edea26c6cd0d34e713fd66c
Closes-Bug: 1301484

commit_message:
Update puppetlabs-rabbitmq dependency

Cinder can now use puppetlabs-rabbitmq < 4. Updated the dependency
to reflect this change.

Change-Id: I3ee14ae7b3535ce2e58dc05594fc141bd013daa1

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-docs refs/changes/57/90657/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: .. _Enable_Disable_Galera_autorebuild: .. index:: HowTo: Galera Cluster Autorebuild HowTo: Enable/Disable Galera Cluster Autorebuild Mechanism ---------------------------------------------------------- By default Fuel reassembles Galera cluster automatically without need for any user interaction. The OCF script looks for existense of `mysqlprimaryinit` variable and tries to assemble the cluster in a following way: - script checks for variable above and for temporary config file created explicitly on deployment stage - if first is present and second missing, then script enters autorebuild phase, otherwise it is skipped; - script checks for the status of the current node - if it is syncronized with quorum, procedure stops, otherwise latest epoch takes place as a corosync variable parameter for selected node; - sleep for five minutes come in place allowing other nodes to join corosync quorum and push their epochs too; - for every node in quorum script does comparison of epochs and if there is at least one node with higher epoch, skips the rest and starts standalone service which will join newly formed cluster later; if there is no higher epochs script checks for temporary `mysqlmaster` flag and neither sets it if flag does not exists nor falls back to the standalong mode; - mysql process launches with empty `gcomm://` string forming a new quorum and `mysqlmaster` deletes immediately, other nodes joins in a very short time. To prevent `autorebuild feature` you should do:: crm_attribute -t crm_config --name mysqlprimaryinit --delete To re-enable `autorebuild feature` you should do:: crm_attribute -t crm_config --name mysqlprimaryinit --update done To try an automated reassemble without reboot if cluster is broken just issue:: crm resource restart clone_p_mysql

commit_message:
Create Keystone v2 endpoint in initialize()

If we are initializing Keystone, we should make certain that it is
in a position to be used after the script is called, to facilitate
that, create a v2 Keystone endpoint.

Change-Id: I46db09f570b082f90f33c177959b678e125eaeff

added_lines: _create_endpoint(keystone, host)def _create_endpoint(keystone, host): """Create keystone endpoint in Keystone. :param keystone: keystone v2 client :param host: ip/hostname of node where Keystone is running """ LOG.debug('Create keystone public endpoint') service = keystone.services.create('keystone', 'identity', description='Keystone Identity Service') keystone.endpoints.create('regionOne', service.id, 'http://%s:5000/v2.0' % host, 'http://%s:35357/v2.0' % host, 'http://%s:5000/v2.0' % host)

commit_message:
Fixes an issue with 3PAR attach

There was a case that during vlun creation
the location returned back from the 3PAR
didn't include the NSP value.

Change-Id: I6c6341fda65df0e8ce148f3d926990a50471a2db
Closes-Bug: #1315542

commit_message:
Raise HTTPForbidden from os-floating-ips API rather than 404

The os-floating-ips extension was catching and handling a 404
and 403 in the same block and raising HTTPNotFound for both.

This change separates the 404 and 403 cases so HTTPForbidden
is returned in the 403 case.  For the 404 case, the test is
updated to raise the proper NovaException and a new test is
added for the 403 Forbidden case.

Change-Id: Id0daf2d61c6960d845d3b7980f96228fece41128

commit_message:
SoftwareDeployments tolerate string zero status code

When evaluating the status code, we treat 0 as OK, but '0' as
a failure, which is inconvenient when returning the status via
shell scripts, so tolerate either format.

Change-Id: Iddac03e38ae87b1103757531ee0247929f9584ac

commit_message:
Fix coverage report for newer versions of coverage

With newer versions of coverage (at least what is installed with ubuntu
trusty), code coverage isn't working.  Making this change allows the
coverage library to find the swift package.

Change-Id: I3b3792622904a86096064c0e03c8095636f83973

subject: Add a Nova Flavor resource.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-24 08:54:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/57e67cfe28f56ffbe9b5426c3301ea47809d9d97', 'message': 'Add a Nova Flavor resource.

This will allow using more fine-grained specification of computational resources (RAM, CPU, disk, etc.)

A nova flavor has the following format:
{
    "heat_template_version": "2013-05-23",
    "Resources": {
        "MyFlavor": {
            "Type": "OS::Nova::Flavor",
            "Properties": {
                "name": "x1.medium",
                "ram": "1024",
                "vcpus": "2",

commit_message:
Add a Nova Flavor resource.

This will allow using more fine-grained specification of computational
resources (RAM, CPU, disk, etc.).

A nova flavor resource has the following format:

  heat_template_version: 2013-05-23
  description:  Heat Flavor creation example
    resources:
      test_flavor:
        type: OS::Nova::Flavor
        properties:
          ram: 1024
          vcpus: 1
          disk: 20
          swap: 2

Change-Id: I79812f0ef0d0dc616ccb3361e9b5864faa877df1
Implements: blueprint dynamic-flavors
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/29/90029/14 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Enforces the use of Credentials (part1)
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-03 14:11:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/f2bba5f78ae0dc3a18e114d95537f1d93de8d81b', 'message': 'Enforces the use of Credentials

Multiversion auth part5

Refactor client managers, tenant isolation and data generator
to use Credentials instead of username, password and tenant_name.
Adapts tests where needed due to the above changes.

Tenant isolation and data generator are still using v2 identity
clients to generate credentials, even when auth_version is set to v3.
This changes prepares the migration to v3.

Partially implements: bp multi-keystone-api-version-tests

Change-Id: If2da9d869af417b6cd8f6a4c48d710e817c76402

password and tenant_name, but keeps the same interface for now,
so test don't have to be changed.

Tenant isolation is  still using v2 identity clients to generate
credentials, even when auth_version is set to v3.
This changes prepares the migration to v3.

Partially implements: bp multi-keystone-api-version-tests

commit_message:
Enforces the use of Credentials (part1)

Multiversion auth part5

Refactor tenant isolation to use Credentials instead of username,
password and tenant_name, but keeps the same interface for now,
so test don't have to be changed.

Tenant isolation is  still using v2 identity clients to generate
credentials, even when auth_version is set to v3.
This changes prepares the migration to v3.

Partially implements: bp multi-keystone-api-version-tests

Change-Id: If2da9d869af417b6cd8f6a4c48d710e817c76402
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/94/77594/20 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if CONF.compute.allow_tenant_isolation or force_tenant_isolation: if getattr(cls, '_interface', None): os = clients.Manager(credentials=creds, os = clients.Manager(credentials=creds, os = clients.Manager(credentials=creds,
deleted_lines: if (CONF.compute.allow_tenant_isolation or force_tenant_isolation): username, tenant_name, password = creds if getattr(cls, '_interface', None): os = clients.Manager(username=username, password=password, tenant_name=tenant_name, os = clients.Manager(username=username, password=password, tenant_name=tenant_name, os = clients.Manager(username=username, password=password, tenant_name=tenant_name,

commit_message:
Use auth data to fill credentials

Provide the ability to automatically fill in credentials
details e.g. IDs if names where provided.
Verified via unit test.

Partially implements: bp multi-keystone-api-version-tests

Change-Id: I505e5024754fe1b912104ce4d5d3206f4cedd6d8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/11/82111/11 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import copy def _verify_credentials(self, klass, filled=True, creds_dict=None): creds = auth.get_default_credentials(credential_type=ctype, fill_in=filled) else: creds = auth.get_credentials(fill_in=filled, **creds_dict) if filled: self.assertIsNotNone(getattr(creds, attr)) else: self.assertIsNone(getattr(creds, attr)) def test_get_credentials_not_filled(self): self.useFixture(fixtures.LockFixture('auth_version')) self._verify_credentials(klass=self.credentials_class, filled=False, creds_dict=self.attributes) def test_reset_all_attributes(self): creds = self._get_credentials() initial_creds = copy.deepcopy(creds) set_attr = creds.__dict__.keys() missing_attr = set(creds.ATTRIBUTES).difference(set_attr) # Set all unset attributes, then reset for attr in missing_attr: setattr(creds, attr, 'fake' + attr) creds.reset() # Check reset credentials are same as initial ones self.assertEqual(creds, initial_creds) def test_reset_single_attribute(self): creds = self._get_credentials() initial_creds = copy.deepcopy(creds) set_attr = creds.__dict__.keys() missing_attr = set(creds.ATTRIBUTES).difference(set_attr) # Set one unset attributes, then reset for attr in missing_attr: setattr(creds, attr, 'fake' + attr) creds.reset() # Check reset credentials are same as initial ones self.assertEqual(creds, initial_creds)
deleted_lines: def _verify_credentials(self, klass, creds_dict=None): creds = auth.get_default_credentials(ctype) else: creds = auth.get_credentials(ctype, **creds_dict) self.assertIsNone(getattr(creds, attr))

commit_message:
Define V3 Credentials

Extend the Credentials class hierarchy to include keystone v3
Credentials. Extend unit tests accordingly.
Extend credentials configurations parameters to include domain.

Partially implements: bp multi-keystone-api-version-tests

Change-Id: I4c7f21f769a20ab45c0f9672ebaa738b146cf6a0

commit_message:
Cleanup container update headers in obj server tests

The object server tests for container backed headers were doing a match
expectation against the backend HeaderKeyDict using a real dict so in tests
the keys were needlessly case sensitive.  This change updates the tests so
they perform correct assertions with case insensitive header keys and removes
some needless string manipulation in the obj server added to satisfy the
overly picky unittests.

There's also a drive by fix to update some backend http mocks for container
update tests that we're not fully exercising their their request fakes.
Because the object server container update code is resilient to to all manor
of failure from backend requests the general intent of the tests was
unaffected but this change cleans up some confusing logging in the debug
logger output.

Change-Id: Iea5ed128b62fd2dc17f55cd8076b711e6087dd26

commit_message:
Fix recursive Policy patching

When using test.unit.patch_policies on a TestCase that subclasses a patched
TestCase the mock policies would be unwound too early.  This change allows you
to subclass a TestCase decorated with patch_policies and get the parent
classes effective POLICIES.

Change-Id: I1b5baefe1ae4281e3be8a5f772994aff4065f981

commit_message:
Fix X-Backend-Storage-Policy-Index requests

The reconciler needs to make PUT/GET requests to specific Storage Policies
despite the cached value of the container_info.

The existing implementation was pulling the request header after it had
already selected the ring and was placing objects on the wrong devices.

Change-Id: I2f92b9ddc1179e0223bcb33fc4cfead50db0ae78

2.6 with fresh simplejson library installed.

The latest commit in oslo-incubator:
- 732bdb6297eb9de81667f7713ebcb1ccc2ee45a7

commit_message:
Vendor any2array function to support stdlib 3.2

Many installations are pinned to stdlib 3.2. This change vendors
the any2arry function from stdlib 4 until Puppet Enterprise
catches up. At that point the vendored function will be removed.

Change-Id: Ide8a9c526ba36a0641c0e118c3280be0e766bd14
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-horizon refs/changes/88/91688/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #! /usr/bin/env ruby -S rspec require 'spec_helper' describe "the any2array function" do let(:scope) { PuppetlabsSpec::PuppetInternals.scope } it "should exist" do Puppet::Parser::Functions.function("any2array").should == "function_any2array" end it "should return an empty array if there is less than 1 argument" do result = scope.function_any2array([]) result.should(eq([])) end it "should convert boolean true to [ true ] " do result = scope.function_any2array([true]) result.should(eq([true])) end it "should convert one object to [object]" do result = scope.function_any2array(['one']) result.should(eq(['one'])) end it "should convert multiple objects to [objects]" do result = scope.function_any2array(['one', 'two']) result.should(eq(['one', 'two'])) end it "should return empty array it was called with" do result = scope.function_any2array([[]]) result.should(eq([])) end it "should return one-member array it was called with" do result = scope.function_any2array([['string']]) result.should(eq(['string'])) end it "should return multi-member array it was called with" do result = scope.function_any2array([['one', 'two']]) result.should(eq(['one', 'two'])) end it "should return members of a hash it was called with" do result = scope.function_any2array([{ 'key' => 'value' }]) result.should(eq(['key', 'value'])) end it "should return an empty array if it was called with an empty hash" do result = scope.function_any2array([{ }]) result.should(eq([])) end end

added_lines: load_constraint, requires_policies, get_storage_policy_from_cluster_info @requires_policies def test_policy_io(self): if tf.skip: raise SkipTest default_policy_list, non_default_policies_list = \ get_storage_policy_from_cluster_info(tf.cluster_info) self.assertEquals(1, len(default_policy_list)) self.assertTrue(len(non_default_policies_list) >= 1) default_policy = default_policy_list[0].get('name') other_policy = non_default_policies_list.pop(0).get('name') # create container with default policy a_con = uuid4().hex def put(url, token, parsed, conn): conn.request('PUT', parsed.path + '/' + a_con, '', {'X-Auth-Token': token, 'X-Storage-Policy': default_policy}) return check_response(conn) resp = retry(put) resp.read() self.assertEqual(resp.status, 201) def head(url, token, parsed, conn, name): conn.request('HEAD', parsed.path + '/' + name, '', {'X-Auth-Token': token}) return check_response(conn) resp = retry(head, a_con) resp.read() self.assert_(resp.status in (200, 204), resp.status) self.assertEqual(resp.getheader('x-storage-policy'), default_policy) # create container with non-default policy another_con = uuid4().hex def put(url, token, parsed, conn): conn.request('PUT', parsed.path + '/' + another_con, '', {'X-Auth-Token': token, 'X-Storage-Policy': other_policy}) return check_response(conn) resp = retry(put) resp.read() self.assertEqual(resp.status, 201) def head(url, token, parsed, conn, name): conn.request('HEAD', parsed.path + '/' + name, '', {'X-Auth-Token': token}) return check_response(conn) resp = retry(head, another_con) resp.read() self.assert_(resp.status in (200, 204), resp.status) self.assertEqual(resp.getheader('x-storage-policy'), other_policy) def post(url, token, parsed, conn, name): conn.request('POST', parsed.path + '/' + name, '', {'X-Auth-Token': token, 'X-Storage-Policy': default_policy}) return check_response(conn) resp = retry(post, another_con) resp.read() self.assertEqual(resp.status, 204) # no change on storage policy resp = retry(head, another_con) resp.read() self.assert_(resp.status in (200, 204), resp.status) self.assertEqual(resp.getheader('x-storage-policy'), other_policy)

commit_message:
Increase PXE deployment timeout for overcloud

The PXE deployment often times out on baremetal deployment with >5
overcloud nodes because the time being measured includes the
dd of the image, which can be slow when many images are sent
from the same undercloud host.

Ideally we'd make the image sizes smaller, and/or make the
undercloud cache the images more sanely.  It would also be
possible to split the timout to measure dd-time and boot-time
separately, but for now we just make the timeout configurable so
a user can raise it if they have problems.

Change-Id: I15540eec7a68eab4c9d128b65a95b1c0a2b64582
Co-Author: nicholas.randon@hp.com

commit_message:
Add ISO 8601 date constraint

Add a constraint to validate that dates are expressed in the format
described by ISO 8601.

Implements: blueprint iso8601-constraint
Change-Id: I1a7e5b75eab94dc78399347517217221c6ad475c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/34/92134/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from heat.engine.resources import iso_8601 from heat.tests.common import HeatTestCase class TestISO8601Constraint(HeatTestCase): def setUp(self): super(TestISO8601Constraint, self).setUp() self.constraint = iso_8601.ISO8601Constraint() def test_validate_date_format(self): date = '2050-01-01' self.assertTrue(self.constraint.validate(date, None)) def test_validate_datetime_format(self): self.assertTrue(self.constraint.validate('2050-01-01T23:59:59', None)) def test_validate_datetime_format_with_utc_offset(self): date = '2050-01-01T23:59:59+00:00' self.assertTrue(self.constraint.validate(date, None)) def test_validate_datetime_format_with_utc_offset_alternate(self): date = '2050-01-01T23:59:59+0000' self.assertTrue(self.constraint.validate(date, None)) def test_validate_refuses_other_formats(self): self.assertFalse(self.constraint.validate('Fri 13th, 2050', None))

commit_message:
Vendor concat function to support stdlib 3.2

Many installations are pinned to stdlib 3.2. This change vendors
the concat function from stdlib 4 until Puppet Enterprise
catches up. At that point the vendored function will be removed.

Change-Id: Ifae939292c7d03b62aa62f205109409c26e9503d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tempest refs/changes/92/91692/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #! /usr/bin/env ruby -S rspec require 'spec_helper' describe "the concat function" do let(:scope) { PuppetlabsSpec::PuppetInternals.scope } it "should raise a ParseError if the client does not provide two arguments" do lambda { scope.function_concat([]) }.should(raise_error(Puppet::ParseError)) end it "should raise a ParseError if the first parameter is not an array" do lambda { scope.function_concat([1, []])}.should(raise_error(Puppet::ParseError)) end it "should be able to concat an array" do result = scope.function_concat([['1','2','3'],['4','5','6']]) result.should(eq(['1','2','3','4','5','6'])) end it "should be able to concat a primitive to an array" do result = scope.function_concat([['1','2','3'],'4']) result.should(eq(['1','2','3','4'])) end it "should not accidentally flatten nested arrays" do result = scope.function_concat([['1','2','3'],[['4','5'],'6']]) result.should(eq(['1','2','3',['4','5'],'6'])) end end

commit_message:
Add Storage Policy Support to Recon Middleware

Recon middleware returns object ring file MD5 sums; this patch
updates it to include other object files that may be present
because of Storage Policies.  Also adds unit test coverage for
the MD5 reporting function which previously had none.

The recon script will now check all rings the server responds with
match the on-disk md5's regardless of server-type; including any
storage policy object rings.

Note the small change to the ring save method, needed to
stimulate the right code paths in 2.6 and 2.7 versions of
gzip to enable testing of ring MD5 sums.

Change-Id: I01efd2999d6d9c57ee8693ac3a6236ace17c5566
Implements: blueprint storage-policies

commit_message:
Allow HDFS data source paths without the hdfs:// scheme

HDFS paths without a leading hdfs:// scheme will be interpreted by
hadoop to refer to the local hdfs.  Relative paths will be treated
as relative to the user running the job; absolute paths will start
at "/" in the local hdfs.  Sahara should allow these forms for
paths so that data sources can simply reference the local hdfs
on a long running cluster.

This can be tested/utilized from the CLI, but the UI will need
an additional change to allow a user to submit these paths.

Partial-Bug: #1315126
Change-Id: I575bf9ff20ff348f7bf2bc52f116b74288b8464a

commit_message:
Don't dynamically create provider types in the global env

Only support this in user environments.
Note: this is only when you have the following in your template
resources:
  thingy:
    type: http://example.com/foo.template

Doing this will avoid tenant-specific provider template URLs being
shown globally in the resource-type listing.

Co-Authored-By: Angus Salkeld <angus.salkeld@rackspace.com>
Closes-Bug: #1311223
Change-Id: Ifa18108afacbda390b19b46a8f41bc4f018e95d6

commit_message:
Always return unicode exception message

Instead of returning a str or unicode (depending on what will
correctly work) always return a unicode message (if non-unicode
is found then replace the invalid unicode with the default
unicode replacement character).

Change-Id: If44332982a27a4c22e8acdb2671f1922f8bfd908
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/taskflow refs/changes/62/87162/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: """Return the unicode representation of an exceptions message.""" def try_bytes(obj, errors): """Try to convert the object to raw bytes.""" if isinstance(obj, bytes): return obj try: if six.PY3: return six.text_type(obj).encode('utf-8') else: return bytes(obj) except UnicodeEncodeError: return six.text_type(obj).encode('utf-8', errors) def try_text(obj, errors): """Try to convert the object to a unicode text string.""" if isinstance(obj, six.text_type): return obj try: if six.PY3: if isinstance(obj, bytes): return six.text_type(obj, 'utf-8', errors) return six.text_type(obj) except UnicodeDecodeError: return six.text_type(try_bytes(obj, errors), 'utf-8', errors) return try_text(exc, 'strict') except UnicodeError: # Give up, convert the exception using replacement mode to cause any # invalid utf8 characters to be replaced, typically with the system # defined replacement character U+FFFD. return try_text(exc, 'replace')
deleted_lines: """Return the string representation of exception.""" return six.text_type(exc) except UnicodeError: return str(exc)

commit_message:
Fixes image creation script to work on CentOS

This patch makes a small fix to the diskimage-create.sh script,
  which allows this script to run on a CentOS 6.4/6.5 machine.
The diskimage-builder project appears to depend upon the
  python-argparse package, but in many cases this is not
  installed by default on CentOS.
This patch resolves this problem by installing the EPEL yum
  repo, as well as the python-argparse, when the CentOS
  platform is detected by the script.

Closes-Bug: #1315140

Change-Id: I51c266337b10b2dd75bf1076a409115dea979226
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sahara-image-elements refs/changes/92/92192/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [ ${platform:0:6} = "CentOS" ]; then # install EPEL repo, in order to install argparse sudo rpm -Uvh --force http://mirrors.kernel.org/fedora-epel/6/i386/epel-release-6-8.noarch.rpm # CentOS requires the python-argparse package be installed separately yum install python-argparse -y fi

commit_message:
fix highlighting on console.html files

the console.html files had improper highlighting because of extra
nesting of pre tags. This was missed the first time around, but
has been driving me nuts for weeks.

The solution is to drop pre tags from files when processing them,
as we're going to wrap it in our own pre tags later. Tests are
updated for the new format.

Change-Id: I5b7f2b0a25ae27a218c51fb73b5fde5055b51578

commit_message:
Documentation updates

* doc/source/index.rst: pbr requires git tags to be signed for using it
  to generate version information. Added a note mentioning this
* doc/source/packagers.rst: documented SKIP_GENERATE_AUTHORS and
  SKIP_WRITE_GIT_CHANGELOG environment variable for packagers.

Change-Id: I153c26f0d6876729dfb95eed2ab031c2aaa890d5
Signed-off-by: Vasudev Kamath <kamathvasudev@gmail.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/pbr refs/changes/09/91609/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: AUTHORS and ChangeLog ===================== `pbr` generates AUTHORS and ChangeLog files from git information. This can cause problem in distro packaging if packager is using git repository for packaging source. If that is the case setting `SKIP_GENERATE_AUTHORS` :: SKIP_GENERATE_AUTHORS=1 will cause logic around generating AUTHORS using git information to be skipped. Similarly setting `SKIP_WRITE_GIT_CHANGELOG` :: SKIP_WRITE_GIT_CHANGELOG=1 will cause logic around generating ChangeLog file using git information to be skipped.

commit_message:
Generate a drop down field for custom heat parameters

If the heat parameter has a custom contraint of 'neutron.network'.
The form will generate choice field with a list of possible networks
to select from.

commit_message:
Allow policy.json file to be specified

The policy.json file was removed in e5beee63c16ceb3499aaee513d368104684f0412
this will allow you to specify an attribute to point to a location of a
policy.json file to be used.

By default this is nil and the packaged policy.json file will be used,
but if required this can be overridden.

Change-Id: Ic3a1b0c507be627acbee1c74302997fa66a72e4b
Implements: blueprint remote-policy

commit_message:
Wrap the failure to load in the not found exception

Wrap the loading of the engine into a not found exception
to match the usage in other entrypoints. This makes the
usage of the various entrypoint loading functions more
consistent.

Change-Id: Id86f7b716c9b3dd76aba411529d2e647ad93a120
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/taskflow refs/changes/99/90499/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from taskflow import exceptions as exc try: mgr = stevedore.driver.DriverManager( namespace, engine_name, invoke_on_load=True, invoke_args=(flow, flow_detail, backend, engine_conf), invoke_kwds=kwargs) engine = mgr.driver except RuntimeError as e: raise exc.NotFound("Could not find engine %s: %s" % (engine_name, e)) else: if store: engine.storage.inject(store) return engine
deleted_lines: mgr = stevedore.driver.DriverManager( namespace, engine_name, invoke_on_load=True, invoke_args=(flow, flow_detail, backend, engine_conf), invoke_kwds=kwargs) engine = mgr.driver if store: engine.storage.inject(store) return engine

Some of the time these attributes are types but other
times they are functions, to avoid the confusion of naming
these with a '_cls' postfix move to having a '_factory' postfix
since these attributes generate other objects (which is what
factories do).

Change-Id: I73edd0c794223d719fbfbd0608c985cb335c8c26
"}]
commit_message:
Engine _cls postfix is not correct

Some of the time these attributes are types but other
times they are functions, to avoid the confusion of naming
these with a '_cls' postfix move to having a '_factory' postfix
since these attributes generate other objects (which is what
factories do).

Change-Id: I73edd0c794223d719fbfbd0608c985cb335c8c26
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/taskflow refs/changes/49/92049/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self._storage = self._storage_factory(self._flow_detail, self._backend) def _storage_factory(self): """Storage factory that will be used to generate storage objects."""
deleted_lines: self._storage = self._storage_cls(self._flow_detail, self._backend) def _storage_cls(self): """Storage class that will be used to generate storage objects."""

Fixed the size limit tests in Python 3

- None cannot be compared to an integer in Python 3
- In Python 3 a request body must be bytes

bp python3

Change-Id: If3944f84d41f54089a8d245848c3012d566385f1

subject: Fix client fixtures
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-05-04 19:56:35.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneclient/tests/client_fixtures.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-keystoneclient/commit/f2adf271e719647b8e3f8bd13dce84a35dfcb932', 'message': "Fix client fixtures

Some of the client fixtures used for testing were invalid. v2
tokens must have 'access'/'token'/'expires', and v3 tokens must
have 'token'/'expires_at'.

Change-Id: I2614c7deed47c9758c2031418110108308634296
Related-Bug: #1174499
"}]
commit_message:
Fix client fixtures

Some of the client fixtures used for testing were invalid. v2
tokens must have 'access'/'token'/'expires', and v3 tokens must
have 'token'/'expires_at'.

commit_message:
Add fault wrapper for rescue function

we might need to record the unsuccessful action for instance,
rescue function currently don't have this method. This patch add
it so that it will record failed rescue action into db.

Change-Id: I615089e7562262dc286a55a2c7228be3201d6d94

added_lines: HOSTS = "hosts" FLOATING_IPS = "floating_IPs" self.hosts = self._get_tuple_list(self.nova_client.hosts.list(), self.HOSTS) self.floating_ips = self._get_tuple_list( self.nova_client.floating_ips.list(), self.FLOATING_IPS) elif type == self.HOSTS: return self.hosts elif type == self.FLOATING_IPS: return self.floating_ips return (self.SERVERS, self.FLAVORS, self.HOSTS) return ("id", "name", "host_id", "status", "tenant_id", elif type == self.HOSTS: return ("host_name", "service", "zone") elif type == self.FLOATING_IPS: return ("floating_ip", "id", "ip", "host_id", "pool") s.user_id, image, flavor) elif type == self.HOSTS: for h in obj: tuple = (h.host_name, h.service, h.zone) t_list.append(tuple) elif type == self.FLOATING_IPS: for i in obj: tuple = (i.fixed_ip, i.id, i.ip, i.instance_id, i.pool) t_list.append(tuple) logger.info("Hosts: %s" % driver.get_all(driver.HOSTS)) logger.info("Floating IPs: %s" % driver.get_all(driver.FLOATING_IPS))

commit_message:
Add notty file for Ironic

ironic-rootwrap fails on Fedora because it requres tty to run sudo.

Change-Id: I602daf1cc639648446b6880a236c730eeeb44644
Closes-Bug: #1307400
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-image-elements refs/changes/53/87253/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/bin/bash set -e if [ -d /etc/sudoers.d ]; then echo "Defaults:ironic !requiretty" > /etc/sudoers.d/ironic-notty chmod 0440 /etc/sudoers.d/ironic-notty visudo -c fi

commit_message:
Update Spark element

Fix Spark element to work with the updated hadoop-cdh element.
Install Spark version 0.9.1 in /opt so that the default user can connect
and immediately start working.
Setup a short firstboot script to take care of file permissions for the
ubuntu user.

Change-Id: I2ab1f810e340b75cf368dd1647816e1d725dd916
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sahara-image-elements refs/changes/40/91340/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: It will install a version of Spark known to be compatible with CDH 4
deleted_lines: It tries to choose the right version of the Spark binaries to install based on the Hadoop version defined in 'DIB_HADOOP_VERSION'.

subject: Add Pillow for stevedore doc build
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-05-02 20:55:09.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/requirements/commit/7ba8be17dcf7d28f27a012ae3047e5d50b3ce6e5', 'message': "Add Pillow for stevedore doc build

As part of setting up gate jobs for stevedore, we have turned on
a doc build gate job. That job is failing because it can't install
Pillow. Nothing else uses Pillow, and it is not a runtime dependency
of stevedore.

This change adds Pillow to the stable/icehouse requirements list
so the check-grenade-dsvm job, which tries to verify that the
requirements for the projects are correct across releases,
will allow the new stevedore to use Pillow.

Change-Id: I96c80ce571bae71ef1b867b0c4f60572fa9a4c5c
"}]
commit_message:
Add Pillow for stevedore doc build

As part of setting up gate jobs for stevedore, we have turned on
a doc build gate job. That job is failing because it can't install
Pillow. Nothing else uses Pillow, and it is not a runtime dependency
of stevedore.

This change adds Pillow to the stable/icehouse requirements list
so the check-grenade-dsvm job, which tries to verify that the
requirements for the projects are correct across releases,
will allow the new stevedore to use Pillow.

Change-Id: I96c80ce571bae71ef1b867b0c4f60572fa9a4c5c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/requirements refs/changes/03/91903/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Pillow==2.4.0 # MIT

commit_message:
Fixes wrong values in get_glance_image_attrs

The output of the glance show command in get_glance_image_attrs
does not get properly converted while being added to the
attrs array.

Change-Id: Ibe503b24ae3bfa10944537d5deaa068a01eaa5f3
Closes-Bug: #1199513

Change-Id: I8b978a604f29953911c2fe4bad74e28e5ba74c35
'}]
commit_message:
Enable configuring tcp keepalive

Added a function set_tcp_keepalive in network_utils.py to set configuration of
tcp keepalive parameters. Projects can call this function and set values in
them, if needed.

Also added unittests to test this function.

Implements blueprint configure-tcp-keepalive
Change-Id: I8b978a604f29953911c2fe4bad74e28e5ba74c35
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo-incubator refs/changes/70/90870/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def configure_tcp_keepalive(socket, tcp_keepidle, tcp_keepalive_interval, tcp_keepalive_count): """ Set values for tcp keepalive parameters. """ # NOTE(praneshp): Despite keepalive being a tcp concept, the level is # still SOL_SOCKET. This is a quirk. socket.setsockopt(socket.SOL_SOCKET, socket.SO_KEEPALIVE, 1) # These options aren't available in the OS X version of eventlet, # Idle + Count * Interval effectively gives you the total timeout. if hasattr(socket, 'TCP_KEEPIDLE'): socket.setsockopt(socket.IPPROTO_TCP, socket.TCP_KEEPIDLE, tcp_keepidle) if hasattr(socket, 'TCP_KEEPINTVL'): socket.setsockopt(socket.IPPROTO_TCP, socket.TCP_KEEPINTVL, tcp_keepalive_interval) if hasattr(socket, 'TCP_KEEPCNT'): socket.setsockopt(socket.IPPROTO_TCP, socket.TCP_KEEPCNT, tcp_keepalive_count)

commit_message:
Run all-in-one instead of sahara-api

We're upgrading sahara architecture, so, we've added an alias to run
sahara in all-in-one process.

Change-Id: I7f92e13c1a9b15070c5ec46428ca3949190abfc9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/00/91900/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: screen_it sahara "cd $SAHARA_DIR && $SAHARA_BIN_DIR/sahara-all --config-file $SAHARA_CONF_FILE"
deleted_lines: screen_it sahara "cd $SAHARA_DIR && $SAHARA_BIN_DIR/sahara-api --config-file $SAHARA_CONF_FILE"

commit_message:
Unit Tests for glance_http

This patch tests most of what is currently in use by Tempest of
glance_http.
There is a comment regarding this matter, but reafirming there is no
class testing against glance_http's https backend since it also ends up
using httplib.

Partially implements bp unit-tests
Change-Id: Iaa2477da4b559e4383fd8904ae4185edcb0dea36
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/54/84454/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import copy class fake_httplib(object): def __init__(self, headers, body=None, version=1.0, status=200, reason="Ok"): """ :param headers: dict representing HTTP response headers :param body: file-like object :param version: HTTP Version :param status: Response status code :param reason: Status code related message. """ self.body = body self.status = status self.reason = reason self.version = version self.headers = headers def getheaders(self): return copy.deepcopy(self.headers).items() def getheader(self, key, default): return self.headers.get(key, default) def read(self, amt): return self.body.read(amt)

commit_message:
Load plugins for scenarios

Load plugins for scenarios from directories
/etc/rally/plugins/scenarios and ~/.rally/plugins/scenarios

Change-Id: Id3bbd7068b5dbe01d5107691d235be2109ae6a2a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rally refs/changes/79/72679/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import imp extra_modules_opt = cfg.ListOpt("extra_modules", default=[], help='list of dirrectories with ' 'extra engines, server providers ' 'or benchmark scenarios modules.') CONF.register_cli_opt(extra_modules_opt) CONF.register_opt(extra_modules_opt) for module in CONF.extra_modules: try: imp.load_source(module[1:].replace("/", ".")[:-3], module) except Exception: print(_("Couldn't load module from %s") % module) raise

Edits in admin-guide-cloud

Move all blockstorage related section files into its own subdirectory
like it is done for other section files.

Follow conventions for service names/project names and capitalization.

added_lines: Set the hostname of the node to controller. Set the hostname of the node to compute1.

commit_message:
Add connection trace for DB2

There was no way to easily configure the connection trace for DB2
like there is for mysql. This adds support for connection tracing
for DB2.

Closes-Bug: #1274523
Change-Id: I681d3b0ac98b8c89413c22d4bbde03fd73b1dc6b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo-incubator refs/changes/63/70163/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: help='Trace SQL commands using an engine-specific method'), if CONF.database.connection_trace: if engine.dialect.dbapi.__name__ == 'MySQLdb': _patch_mysqldb_with_stacktrace_comments() elif engine.dialect.dbapi.__name__ == 'ibm_db_dbi': _patch_ibm_db_with_log_stacktrace()def _patch_ibm_db_with_log_stacktrace(): """Logs stack trace before executing the query. Patches ibm_db_dbi.Cursor.execute. """ import ibm_db_dbi import traceback old_execute = ibm_db_dbi.Cursor.execute def _do_execute(self, operation, *args, **kwargs): stack = '' for file, line, method, function in traceback.extract_stack(): # exclude various common things from trace if method == 'wrapper' or method == '_wrap': continue if method == '_inner' or method == 'inner': continue # db/api is just a wrapper around db/sqlalchemy/api if file.endswith('db/api.py'): continue # exclude itself if file.endswith('session.py') and method == '_do_execute': continue # only trace inside oslo if 'oslo' not in file: continue # exclude COMMIT - too many of these calls if file.endswith('models.py') and method == 'save': stack = '' break stack += '\tFile %s:%s %s() %s\n' % (file, line, method, function) if stack: # strip the last new-line stack = stack[:-1] LOG.info('ibm_db_dbi stack trace: %s\n%s', operation, stack) old_execute(self, operation, *args, **kwargs) setattr(ibm_db_dbi.Cursor, 'execute', _do_execute)
deleted_lines: help='Add python stack traces to SQL as comment strings'), if (CONF.database.connection_trace and engine.dialect.dbapi.__name__ == 'MySQLdb'): _patch_mysqldb_with_stacktrace_comments()

added_lines: 4.0.0 - 2014.1.0 - Icehouse **4.0.0** * Stable Icehouse release. * Added template_file parameter to specify catalog. * Added keystone::config to handle additional custom options. * Added notification parameters. * Added support for puppetlabs-mysql 2.2 and greater. * Fixed deprecated sql section header in keystone.conf. * Fixed deprecated bind_host parameter. * Fixed example for native type keystone_service. * Fixed LDAP module bugs. * Fixed variable for host_access dependency. * Reduced default token duration to one hour. **3.2.0** * Added ability to configure any catalog driver. * Ensures log_file is absent when using syslog. **3.1.1** * Fixed inconsistent variable for mysql allowed hosts.

added_lines: 4.0.0 - 2014.1.0 - Icehouse **4.0.0** * Stable Icehouse release. * Added Neutron-Nova interactions support. * Added external network bridge and interface driver for vpn agent. * Added support for puppetlabs-mysql 2.2 and greater. * Added neutron::config to handle additional custom options. * Added https support to metadata agent. * Added manage_service paraneter. * Added quota parameters. * Added support to configure ovs without installing package. * Added support for optional haproxy package management. * Added support to configure plugins by name rather than class name. * Added multi-worker support. * Added isolated network support. * Updated security group option for ml2 plugin. * Updated packaging changes for Red Hat and Ubuntu systems. * Updated parameter defaults to track upstream (Icehouse). * Fixed bug for subnets with empty values. * Fixed typos and misconfiguration in neutron.conf. * Fixed max_retries parameter warning. * Fixed database creation bugs. **3.3.0** * Added neutron_port resource. * Added external network bridge for vpn agent. * Changed dhcp_lease_duration to Havana default of 86400 * Fixed VPNaaS installation for Red Hat systems. * Fixed conflicting symlink. * Fixed network_vlan_ranges parameter for OVS plugin

commit_message:
use zypper dist-upgrade instead of zypper update

I think it's better to use zypper dist-ugrade instead of
zypper update to make sure that packages of higher versions
maybe avaialble in the OBS repositories are applied.
zypper update will not apply them because a vendor-change
is necessary.

Change-Id: Ia735ec0a15e27c8e90955c388235cfc520cd21cb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/84/92084/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: <prompt>#</prompt> <userinput>zypper update</userinput></screen>

commit_message:
Uninstall more buildtime only deps and clean lists

- Apt lists were not getting cleaned out, adding almost 100M of unneeded
  stuff to the final image.
- Also removed some unneeded post-build deps

Change-Id: I716aba65ae0e9153a64a359f431d6d8a6adfb4da

deleted_lines: RUN apt-get -y purge gcc python2.7-dev git && apt-get clean

commit_message:
only call sink handlers for supported event types

Make sure the event is in the handler's list of supported event types.

Closes-Bug: #1315171

Change-Id: Id50a4a42a8dddbffb85b5fbca43f1b7f31447874

commit_message:
Fixed issue Unit Test requested Image from Internet

test_verify fails when there is no internet connection. Fixed this issue
by mocking the urlopen which downloaded the image from internet.Also included
a try except block to detect the error and raise exception when downloading the
image when no internet is detected.
Closes-bug: #1308466

commit_message:
Added check_ready test for some docker containers

This works around the problem where docker containers
could take more time to deploy than anticipated on
systems with heavy load. A series of loops are added
with timeouts to ensure these apps are ready.

Change-Id: I731177d1c9a6fa35897e1ec592557c27a983166b
Partial-Bug: #1315865

commit_message:
Add create() and destroy() to Node

What it says. Also make the code use them vs direct calls to dbapi. This
also removes passing context to node.refresh() and node.save() since
context is cached on the Node object on create.

Partial-Bug: 1314732

Change-Id: Id3fafe1eae70954095ed94dec86e4583b23c5af8

deleted_lines: new_node = pecan.request.dbapi.create_node(node.as_dict()) # Ignore fields that aren't exposed in the API

commit_message:
Don't translate debug level logs in nova.cert, console and consoleauth

Our translation policy
(https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/LoggingStandards#Log_Translation) calls
for not translating debug level logs. This is to help prioritize log
translation. Furthermore translation has a performance overhead, even if
the log isn't used (since nova doesn't support lazy translation yet).

Change-Id: I9a0c718fc71e456baf87d1d28827654a015c62a6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/63/90963/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: LOG.debug('Adding console') LOG.debug('Tried to remove non-existent console ' '%(console_id)s.', {'console_id': console_id}) LOG.debug('Removing console ' '%(console_id)s.', {'console_id': console_id})
deleted_lines: from nova.openstack.common.gettextutils import _ LOG.debug(_('Adding console')) LOG.debug(_('Tried to remove non-existent console ' '%(console_id)s.') % {'console_id': console_id}) LOG.debug(_('Removing console ' '%(console_id)s.') % {'console_id': console_id})

commit_message:
Don't translate debug level logs in nova.cmd and nova.db

Our translation policy
(https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/LoggingStandards#Log_Translation) calls
for not translating debug level logs. This is to help prioritize log
translation. Furthermore translation has a performance overhead, even if
the log isn't used (since nova doesn't support lazy translation yet).

Change-Id: I8fa50e469384f4b626ae6aa47e9ca0b8e29da404

commit_message:
Update server groups extension to describe parameter restrictions

name and policy name must be from 1 to 255 characters long, a string,
with no leading or trailing spaces

Closes-Bug: #1292581

Change-Id: I7e1151d3f42a5a4e59a4735879805712bab260b6
author: diane fleming
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/api-site refs/changes/84/91884/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: <para>The name for the server group. The name is required and must be a string from 1 to 255 characters long with no leading or trailing spaces.</para></wadl:doc> <para>A list of one or more policy names to associate with the server group. You must specify at least one policy name in the list. Each policy name must be a string from 1 to 255 characters long with no leading or trailing spaces.</para></wadl:doc>
deleted_lines: <para>The name for the server group.</para></wadl:doc> <para>One or more policies to associate with the server group.</para></wadl:doc>

added_lines: Use to request a specific page size. Expect a response to a limited request to return between zero and limit items. The typical pattern of limit and marker is to make an initial limited request and then to use the ID of the last image from the response as the marker parameter in a subsequent limited request. Specifies the ID of the last-seen image. The typical pattern of limit and marker is to make an initial limited request and then to use the ID of the last image from the response as the marker parameter in a subsequent limited request. Filter parameter. Name of the image as a string. Filter parameter. Image visibility. Valid values are public, private, and shared.Default is public + private + shared images with accepted member status. Filter parameter. Only show images with the specified member status. Valid values are accepted, pending, rejected, and all. Default is accepted. Filter parameter. Shows images shared with me by the specified owner, where the owner is indicated by tenant ID. Filter parameter. The image status, such as queued, saving, active, killed, deleted, and pending_delete. Filter parameter. Value of the minimum size of the image in bytes. Filter parameter. Value of the maximum size of the image in bytes. Sort key. All image attributes can be used as the sort_key, except tags and link attributes. Default is created_at. Sort direction. Valid values are asc (ascending) and desc (descending). Default is desc. Image tag. For example, ?tag="cirros". '> Image ID stored through the image API. Typically a UUID. ' > Image tag. ' > Image member ID. For example, the tenant ID of the user with whom the image is being shared. ' > Status to which this image member should be set. Valid values are pending, accepted, and rejected. commit_message:
Don't translate debug level logs in nova.compute

Our translation policy
(https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/LoggingStandards#Log_Translation) calls
for not translating debug level logs. This is to help prioritize log
translation. Furthermore translation has a performance overhead, even if
the log isn't used (since nova doesn't support lazy translation yet).

Continuation of Ie1068d2d2c7c37f27c62d0e4e5a64a1a504af9f5

Change-Id: Id6ed926df97fe31b4d553546818de5356e3a4cbb

commit_message:
tempest py26 setup

Simplifying the steps between devstack install and tempest run, by
 * installing tox<1.7, bacuse 1.7 is not compatible with our tox.ini
 * installing and patching 'discover' when the python version is 2.6

Change-Id: I8008837d2fae6cebeeeb051b63066279ca477e01
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/34/86834/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: pip_install tox==1.6.1 if python --version 2>&1 | grep -q 'Python 2.6'; then install_package python-unittest2 patch pip_install discover (cd /usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/; sudo patch <"$FILES/unittest2-discover.patch" || echo 'Assume already applied') fi
deleted_lines: # TODO(afazekas): # sudo python setup.py deploy

commit_message:
Workaround the Gerrit upgrade timestamp issue

Hopefully ignores all of the bogus timestamps that the Gerrit
upgrade added to votes.  This means that only votes since the
upgrade will show up though, so I'm not sure this should be merged.
There is work in progress to fix the timestamps in the db which
will hopefully obsolete this.

Change-Id: I054547a30f3ed94efd2603e21cbe7b3b10cbf40a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/reviewstats refs/changes/06/91606/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Temporary workaround for the fact that the Gerrit 2.8 upgrade reset # all of the existing review timestamps to a small set of values. if review['grantedOn'] <= 1398706292: continue

commit_message:
Add KeyName to Instance heat template

Adds an ssh keyname if specified to the Heat template; it is optional
and defaults to null.

Change-Id: Id80cf403f834a9ed8d3a0660a2687ab17ddb0f6d

commit_message:
removed	introductive comment in configuration example

To avoid confusions about the location of the configuration example
it's better to not mention it at all directly in the configuration
example.

Change-Id: I2668a563bfc41c30cfe44b1630455dc5a49e4133

commit_message:
chore: Classify as Beta (was pre-alpha)

Now that the library covers the entire API and seems somewhat
stable, let's reclassify it before publishing to PyPI.

Change-Id: I430c96ca34ee36d63189ea4e44e9d4726f934a10

commit_message:
Fixed a bug when the Heat template was not deleted on Env deletion

API now passes an empty 'applications' list as part of environment instead
of a Null-environment

Also, the incomplete 'destroy' section of the Instance class has been removed
This needs to be fixed later, however the current version is fine, as the stack
will be properly deleted by the environment deploy code

Change-Id: I176d5026ade2b0092381b0b2f9bb6273ec21abf7
Closes-bug: #1308910

commit_message:
Full support of multiple hosts in transport url

This patch add the support of multiple hosts in transport url for rabbit and
qpid drivers. And also fix the amqp connection pool management to allow
to have one pool by transport.

Implements blueprint multiple-hosts-support-in-url

Co-Authored-By: Ala Rezmerita <ala.rezmerita@cloudwatt.com>
Change-Id: I5aff24d292b67a7b65e33e7083e245efbbe82024

deleted_lines: def __init__(self, conf, connection_cls): return self.connection_cls(self.conf) self.connection_cls.pool = Nonedef get_connection_pool(conf, connection_cls): if not connection_cls.pool: connection_cls.pool = ConnectionPool(conf, connection_cls) return connection_cls.pool def __init__(self, conf, connection_pool, pooled=True, server_params=None): self.connection = connection_pool.connection_cls( conf, server_params=server_params)

commit_message:
Reject option names prefixed with '_'

Such names are used for _Namespace's internal purposes.

Change-Id: I08c24f05ec3ef626b253ca3682439c1a162959e5
Related-Bug: #1284969

subject: Add network API test to create/update a port with 2 IP addresses
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-17 18:44:25.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/b373c8f33311c869304f8af6dcf0618c34f434f9', 'message': 'Add API test for create/delete/update port with 2 IP addresses

Also includes some code refactoring, including helper methods to
create and delete networks and subnets.

Also includes "safe" delete methods for network, subnet and port,
which are safe in the sense that NotFound exceptions are ignored.
These methods could be used wherever a delete of a resource is
being done as part of the test, but we still want to add a
cleanup delete task to ensure that the resource gets deleted
when the test gets interrupted by an exception.

commit_message:
Add network API test to create/update a port with 2 IP addresses

Test sequence is as follows:
- Create a network with 2 subnets.
- Create a port on the network with single IP addr from
  first subnet.
- Update port with a second IP addr from second subnet.
- Update port to return to a single IP addr.
- Clean up resources (port, subnets, and network) via
  the tearDownClass method of the BaseNetworkTest class.

Change-Id: I0036cd7fe412f4a371027fc5c323a7bc3ccce5b9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/47/67547/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def update_port(self, port_id, name=None, fixed_ips=None): if name: p2 = Element("name", name) port.append(p2) if fixed_ips: p2 = Element("fixed_ips") for fixed_ip in fixed_ips: p3 = Element("fixed_ip") for key, value in fixed_ip.items(): p4 = Element(key, value) p3.append(p4) p2.append(p3) port.append(p2)
deleted_lines: def update_port(self, port_id, name): p2 = Element("name", name) port.append(p2)

commit_message:
Storage services need keystoneclient not keystone

The service recipes have been pulling in the entire
python-keystone package, which is the entire Keystone
set of services. This hasn't been necessary since
some time after Grizzly, when the tokenauth middleware
was moved to the client.

Change-Id: I6d326352ab5c8079cc5c405161475ec0354c5593
Related-Bug: #1305318

commit_message:
Implement instance rebuild in nova.virt.driver

This implementation of the rebuild operation allows the use of
the --preserve-ephemeral option. The default implementation in
Nova does not support this option.

Note: Image validation is not handled with this change.

Change-Id: I933658d139dc16ef1a65378b0084b4baf6180651
Closes-Bug: #1307754

commit_message:
Heat services need keystoneclient not keystone

The common recipe has been pulling in the entire
python-keystone package, which is the entire Keystone
set of services. This hasn't been necessary since
some time after Grizzly, when the tokenauth middleware
was moved to the client.

Change-Id: Ifb133d570e2ad94df822aa512edeb37aabdf349b
Related-Bug: #1305318

commit_message:
Allow packages to be updatable

In order for package updates to occur, package resources need to use
the upgrade action.

Change-Id: I39469096c6965731befa443c56968820ec97dc20
Implements: blueprint allow-package-updates

deleted_lines: action :install action :install

commit_message:
VMWare - Check for compute node before triggering destroy

While booting an instance, if Claim on that compute node is not successful
compute manager triggers a call to destroy instance. Destroy fails since the
compute node (Cluster/ESX host) is set only after claim is successful.
Hence the check for node is made before destroy, to ensure that exception
does not get thrown. This ensures that the instance gets rescheduled
Closes-Bug: #1307408

Change-Id: Iaaf931e9c1e6cf046497e2c64952f92e802ad4be
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/94/87894/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.instance_without_compute = {'node': None, 'vm_state': 'building', 'project_id': 'fake', 'user_id': 'fake', 'name': '1', 'display_description': '1', 'kernel_id': '1', 'ramdisk_id': '1', 'mac_addresses': [ {'address': 'de:ad:be:ef:be:ef'} ], 'memory_mb': 8192, 'instance_type': 'm1.large', 'vcpus': 4, 'root_gb': 80, 'image_ref': '1', 'host': 'fake_host', 'task_state': 'scheduling', 'reservation_id': 'r-3t8muvr0', 'id': 1, 'uuid': 'fake-uuid', 'metadata': []} def test_destroy_instance_without_compute(self): self.assertIsNone(self.conn.destroy(self.context, self.instance_without_compute, self.network_info)) def test_destroy(self): self._create_vm() info = self.conn.get_info({'uuid': self.uuid, 'node': self.instance_node}) self._check_vm_info(info, power_state.RUNNING) instances = self.conn.list_instances() self.assertEqual(len(instances), 1) self.conn.destroy(self.context, self.instance, self.network_info) instances = self.conn.list_instances() self.assertEqual(len(instances), 0) self.assertIsNone(vm_util.vm_ref_cache_get(self.uuid)) def test_destroy_no_datastore(self): self._create_vm() info = self.conn.get_info({'uuid': self.uuid, 'node': self.instance_node}) self._check_vm_info(info, power_state.RUNNING) instances = self.conn.list_instances() self.assertEqual(len(instances), 1) # Overwrite the vmPathName vms = vmwareapi_fake._get_objects("VirtualMachine") vm = vms.objects[0] vm.set("config.files.vmPathName", None) self.conn.destroy(self.context, self.instance, self.network_info) instances = self.conn.list_instances() self.assertEqual(len(instances), 0) def test_destroy_non_existent(self): self._create_instance() self.assertIsNone(self.conn.destroy(self.context, self.instance, self.network_info)) def test_destroy_instance_without_compute(self): self.assertIsNone(self.conn.destroy(self.context, self.instance_without_compute, self.network_info))

commit_message:
Add dev libs for xml2 and xslt to install_rally.sh

`libxml2-dev` and `libxslt1-dev` are missed from dependencies in
Rally installation script. This patch fixed this.

Change-Id: I1a2ea90a7b86df74f2357ca7fa4111973d4ef60e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rally refs/changes/85/92085/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: local external_dependencies='libxml2-devel libxslt1-devel' # dependencies from projects, which are used by rally yum -y install ${install_rally_dependencies} ${cryptography_dependencies} ${external_dependencies} local external_dependencies='libxml2-dev libxslt1-dev' # dependencies from projects, which are used by rally apt-get -y install ${install_rally_dependencies} ${cryptography_dependencies} ${external_dependencies}
deleted_lines: yum -y install ${install_rally_dependencies} ${cryptography_dependencies} apt-get -y install ${install_rally_dependencies} ${cryptography_dependencies}

subject: Add _wrap_db_error support for postgresql
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-20 03:33:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo-incubator/commit/739810336157febcb8aa42b084a520624b7adeeb', 'message': 'Add _retry_on_deadlock support for postgresql

The original "_retry_on_deadlock" function is only available for mysql.

commit_message:
Add _wrap_db_error support for postgresql

The original "_wrap_db_error" function is only available for mysql.
We need to add support for postgresql.

The deadlock exception thrown from postgresql is TransactionRollbackError,
it's not the same with "OperationalError" thrown from mysql,
and isn't included in sqlalchemy. So, the base exception need to be
catched.

Change-Id: Idf944e30dfcfb6c0c0df022935c8809cec0a28bb
Closes-Bug: #1270725
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo-incubator refs/changes/17/74917/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # # postgresql: # (TransactionRollbackError) deadlock detected <deadlock_details> # _DEADLOCK_RE_DB = { "mysql": re.compile(r"^.*\(1213, 'Deadlock.*"), "postgresql": re.compile(r"^.*deadlock detected.*") except sqla_exc.DBAPIError as e: # NOTE(wingwj): This branch is used to catch deadlock exception # under postgresql. The original exception thrown from postgresql # is TransactionRollbackError, it's not included in the sqlalchemy. # Moreover, DBAPIError is the base class of OperationalError # and IntegrityError, so we catch it on the end of the process. _raise_if_db_connection_lost(e, self.bind) _raise_if_deadlock_error(e, self.bind.dialect.name) raise
deleted_lines: _DEADLOCK_RE_DB = { "mysql": re.compile(r"^.*\(1213, 'Deadlock.*")

commit_message:
Add protection for Query deadlock in sqlalchemy

The function '@_wrap_db_error' and '@retry_on_dead_lock',
is only available for session deadlock(query/flush/execute).

But it doesn't cover some 'Query' actions.

So, we need to add the same protction for 'all()' in sqlalchemy.

Change-Id: Ia15d1004a8da43652a5a98e106f4425315aaf6c4
Closes-Bug: #1283987
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo-incubator refs/changes/02/75802/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @_wrap_db_error def all(self): # Note (wingwj): For deadlock protection return super(Query, self).all()

commit_message:
Clear `pending_deletion` flag on Env reset

If we mark some node as 'pending_deletion' and then reset the environment,
the node will have both 'pending_deletion' and 'pending_addition' flags.

Since now, the reset environment process clears 'pending_deletion` flag.

Change-Id: I72182e5bdbe07a399fd16f71559cacf599d7a9a4
Closes-Bug: #1310604

deleted_lines: "pending_addition": True

commit_message:
Move path to SSH key in settings.yaml

Use a path to SSH key from the settings.yaml, instead hardcoded one
during generating config for Shotgun.

Closes-Bug: 1314600
Change-Id: I66f6d163e8ec29bfd552df5e1b59fe9d24a62542

added_lines: # -*- coding: utf-8 -*- # Copyright 2014 Mirantis, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import mock from nailgun.test import base from nailgun.settings import settings from nailgun.task import task class TestSnapshotConf(base.TestCase): def test_must_have_roles(self): conf = task.DumpTask.conf() self.assertIn('local', conf['dump']) self.assertIn('master', conf['dump']) self.assertIn('slave', conf['dump']) def test_local_host(self): conf = task.DumpTask.conf() # local role is abstract, but we have to make sure that it's # real localhost and there's only one host self.assertEqual(len(conf['dump']['local']['hosts']), 1) self.assertEqual( conf['dump']['local']['hosts'][0]['address'], 'localhost') def test_master_injection(self): conf = task.DumpTask.conf() self.assertEqual(conf['dump']['master']['hosts'][0], { 'address': settings.MASTER_IP, 'ssh-key': settings.SHOTGUN_SSH_KEY, }) def test_postgres_injection(self): conf = task.DumpTask.conf() for object_ in conf['dump']['local']['objects']: if object_['type'] == 'postgres': self.assertEqual( object_['dbhost'], settings.DATABASE['host']) self.assertEqual( object_['dbname'], settings.DATABASE['name']) self.assertEqual( object_['username'], settings.DATABASE['user']) self.assertEqual( object_['password'], settings.DATABASE['passwd']) break else: self.fail("A `postgres` object MUST BE in `local` objects!") @mock.patch('nailgun.task.task.db') def test_slave_generating(self, mock_db): ( mock_db.return_value.query.return_value.filter.return_value. all.return_value ) = [ mock.Mock(fqdn='node1'), mock.Mock(fqdn='node2') ] conf = task.DumpTask.conf() self.assertIn({ 'address': 'node1', 'ssh-key': settings.SHOTGUN_SSH_KEY, }, conf['dump']['slave']['hosts']) self.assertIn({ 'address': 'node2', 'ssh-key': settings.SHOTGUN_SSH_KEY, }, conf['dump']['slave']['hosts'])

commit_message:
check_dhcp return list in case KeyboardInterrupt

The only case when check_dhcp_on_eth is able to return bool
is KeybordInterrupt exception catching in timeout.run_with_timeout

It is required to be compliant with general fuelmenu flow

Change-Id: I60d670976bf9c5bd7804277ec8b1aa9ca77ee3b4
Related-Bug: #1313354

commit_message:
Fixed a bug when the Heat template was not deleted on Env deletion

API now passes an empty 'applications' list as part of environment instead
of a Null-environment

The cleanup phase of model load is no longer executed for case when there
are no applications in the environment

Closes-bug: #1308910

Change-Id: I0308e8767b4ce605b366851fbc445612841ac09c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/murano refs/changes/20/92120/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # if no applications in the env, then no need to cleanup, as the whole # env is going to be removed apps = data.get('Objects', {}).get('applications') if not apps or len(apps) == 0: return

commit_message:
Support 'InvalidPowerState' exception

The aforementioned exception is used to determine if a VM is
already powered on. This was introduced in the spwan refactor:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/83207/.

Change-Id: I35fa88cdae5d488d0dbf65346aa5903e5eec17fb

commit_message:
Add multiple rabbit hosts support

* Use new oslo.messaging conf options for rabbit_hosts and
  rabbit_ha_queues for glance::notify::rabbitmq class
* Warn on deprecated rabbit_durable_queues and use amqp_* instead
* Fix/add rspecs
* Fix a mess with wrong notification_driver usage
* Update README with usage example

DocImpact
Closes-bug: #1259193
Closes-bug: #1312054
Closes-bug: #1312658
Closes-bug: #1313553

Change-Id: I16b8e71db20602986a7afe8d24e7faba91a0997f
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>

Add cli cluster creation and teardown test

Change-Id: I1b694163eff2cea2104178738b82f2ebb16f1343
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-saharaclient refs/changes/85/89585/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import json import six import tempfile import time def find_image_by_id(self, id): return self.client.images.get(id) def find_cluster_by_id(self, id): return self.client.clusters.get(id) def find_node_group_template_by_id(self, id): return self.client.node_group_templates.get(id) def find_cluster_template_by_id(self, id): return self.client.cluster_templates.get(id) def find_object_by_field(self, val, obj_list, field="name"): for obj in obj_list: if getattr(obj, field) == val: return obj def find_node_group_template_by_name(self, name): return self.find_object_by_field( name, self.client.node_group_templates.list()) def find_cluster_template_by_name(self, name): return self.find_object_by_field(name, self.client.cluster_templates.list()) def find_cluster_by_name(self, name): return self.find_object_by_field(name, self.client.clusters.list()) def generate_json_file(self, temp): f = tempfile.NamedTemporaryFile(delete=True) f.write(json.dumps(temp)) f.flush() return f def poll_cluster_state(self, id): cluster = self.client.clusters.get(id) #TODO(tmckay): this should use timeutils but we need #to add it to openstack/common timeout = common['CLUSTER_CREATION_TIMEOUT'] * 60 while str(cluster.status) != 'Active': if str(cluster.status) == 'Error' or timeout <= 0: break time.sleep(10) timeout -= 10 cluster = self.client.clusters.get(id) return str(cluster.status) class AssertionWrappers(object): def check_dict_elems_in_obj(self, d, obj, exclude=[]): for key, val in six.iteritems(d): if key not in exclude: self.assertEqual(val, getattr(obj, key)) def check_dict_is_subset(self, dict1, dict2): # There is an assert for this in Python 2.7 but not 2.6 self.assertTrue(all( k in dict2 and dict2[k] == v for k, v in six.iteritems(dict1)))

commit_message:
Added simplejson dependency to test requirements

In oslo-incubator, we need to test jsonutils with multiple json
libraries, including simplejson. This is not a strict runtime
dependency, so we don't want to pollute requirements.txt with a new
dependency. Instead, we want to have it required for tests only and
recommended for some (py26) runtimes.

Change-Id: I8d4833a2d17003fd79cd1f60fae78f162aebf44d
Related-Bug: 1314129
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/requirements refs/changes/98/92098/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

This is just a work in progress to get feedback on how to go about doing
this.  This is the first step towards the auto heal/convergence
blueprint (stack-convergence).

The idea is to issue an RPC call to loop over all the resources of a
stack, gather information regarding their current statuses and an
expected state, and return the results on a dict.

No tests right now, just spiking.

Blueprint: check-stack

Change-Id: I4e39bfe6a3dca04305563844d5922da7e0bb67b3

commit_message:
Check resources are in expected states

Allow resource to check whether it is in an expected state and update
status and action accordingly.

This first step only allows the base Resource class to perform a check
that will always fail with a NotSupported error.  This allows for the
other resources to implement their own checks for their expected states.

Implements: blueprint stack-check (partial)
Change-Id: I4e39bfe6a3dca04305563844d5922da7e0bb67b3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/41/58641/34 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: stack_mapper.connect("stack_check", "/stacks/{stack_name}/{stack_id}/check", action="check", conditions={'method': 'GET'})

subject: Report: Fix JinjaView deepcopy
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-06 19:39:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo-incubator/commit/9a1b45f85071034aa0d9a3651a45cbb4b6f9d4b9', 'message': "Report: Fix JinjaView deepcopy

Previously, JinjaView used the default implementation of deepcopy.
Unfortunately, this meant that attempting to stringify the same model
with an attached JinjaView twice would fail, since Jinja's Template
class fails to deepcopy.

Now, a __deepcopy__ method has been explicitly writen for JinjaView
which reuses the Jinja Template (since two Templates for the same
text are logically going to be the same anyway).

Change-Id: Id040255138ecd48acd942d0d8ef75ed643e15403
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-04-11 19:58:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo-incubator/commit/59a8e0fbc4dcfe10b374ae040cf59f3c9992254a', 'message': "Report: Fix JinjaView deepcopy

commit_message:
Report: Fix JinjaView deepcopy

Previously, JinjaView used the default implementation of deepcopy.
Unfortunately, this meant that attempting to stringify the same model
with an attached JinjaView twice would fail, since Jinja's Template
class fails to deepcopy.

Now, JinjaView has an explicit __deepcopy__ method.

Change-Id: Id040255138ecd48acd942d0d8ef75ed643e15403
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo-incubator refs/changes/30/78730/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import copy def __deepcopy__(self, memodict): res = object.__new__(JinjaView) res._text = copy.deepcopy(self._text, memodict) # if we already have a template, there's no reason to copy it # (plus Jinja Template objects can't be deepcopied or copied # at this time) if self._templatecache and not self._regentemplate: res._regentemplate = False res._templatecache = self._templatecache else: res._regentemplate = True res._templatecache = None return res

commit_message:
Add TestCase assertion methods for testing checks

This patch adds assertCheckPasses and assertCheckFails methods to make
it easier to write tests for more complicated checks that we want to
add.

We rely on checks being generators at this point, meaning this will not
work on flake8 class based plugins.

Change-Id: I37ecec271006084211e37c4fc9c89d71df01dc97
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/hacking refs/changes/78/80278/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def assertCheckFails(self, check_func, *args, **kwargs): if len(list(check_func(*args, **kwargs))) != 1: raise AssertionError("Check %s did not fail." % check_func.__name__) def assertCheckPasses(self, check_func, *args, **kwargs): try: self.assertCheckFails(check_func, *args, **kwargs) except AssertionError: return else: raise AssertionError("Check %s failed." % check_func.__name__)

commit_message:
Use oslotest by default

Update the test requirements list to use oslotest by default,
and to bring in all of the other dependencies via oslotest.

Change-Id: Ibd6e1c5c3726660527bacd203dbc9cb4e6042588

commit_message:
Fix Cell description

Issues fixed:
* Remove obsolete comment about cell scheduling
* Fix api username/password to follow previous example
* Add missing closing parenthesis
* Wrap overlong screen lines
* Use replaceable for example

Change-Id: If99ec8d091ee1f7abfb4138e0668e0de9c3a97cf
Closes-Bug: #1315136
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/52/91752/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: <para>Cells scheduling is separate from host scheduling. <systemitem class="service">nova-cells</systemitem> first picks a cell. Once a cell is selected and the new build request reaches its <systemitem class="service">nova-cells</systemitem> service, it is sent over to the host scheduler in that cell and the build proceeds as it would have without cells.</para> root:<screen><prompt>#</prompt> <userinput>nova-manage cell create --name=api --cell_type=parent --username=api_user --password=api_passwd --hostname=10.0.0.10 --port=5672 --virtual_host=api_vhost --woffset=1.0 --wscale=1.0 <xref linkend="scheduler-filters"/>).</para>
deleted_lines: <para>Cells scheduling is separate from host scheduling. <systemitem class="service">nova-cells</systemitem> first picks a cell (now randomly, but future releases plan to add filtering/weighing functionality, and decisions will be based on broadcasts of capacity/capabilities). Once a cell is selected and the new build request reaches its <systemitem class="service">nova-cells</systemitem> service, it is sent over to the host scheduler in that cell and the build proceeds as it would have without cells.</para> root:<screen><prompt>#</prompt> <userinput>nova-manage cell create --name=api --cell_type=parent --username=api1_user --password=api1_passwd --hostname=10.0.0.10 --port=5672 --virtual_host=api_vhost --woffset=1.0 --wscale=1.0 <xref linkend="scheduler-filters"/>.</para>

commit_message:
Fixing deprecated libvirt options for nova.conf

[DEFAULT] => [libvirt]
libvirt_type => virt_type
libvirt_NAME => NAME

Closes-bug: #1253812

Change-Id: I154ff62954bda5562f7e9c9ca1e56feecf18faf1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/54/91954/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: <para>By default, the selected hypervisor is KVM. To change to another hypervisor, change the <literal>virt_type</literal> option in the <literal>[libvirt]</literal> section of <filename>nova.conf</filename> and restart the <systemitem class="service" >nova-compute</systemitem> service.</para>
deleted_lines: <para>By default, the selected hypervisor is KVM. To change to another hypervisor, change the <literal>libvirt_type</literal> option in <filename>nova.conf</filename> and restart the <systemitem class="service">nova-compute</systemitem> service.</para>
